SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange had sought clarification from Maruti Suzuki India Limited with respect to a news item captioned "Maruti bags army order for 4,000 Gypsys, its largest yet". The Company has clarified that "The Company has received an order for supply of 4141 Gypsy vehicles from the Indian Army in the ordinary course of business. The Company sells about 12 Lac vehicles per annum with a turnover close to Rs. 45,000 Crore. Keeping in view such a large scale of operations of the Company, this particular order is approximately 0.34% of the total number of vehicles sold by the Company in a year. Further, over the last 30 years or so, the Company, from time to time, has been supplying Gypsy to Army & other para security forces. Hence, this event is neither unprecedented nor material enough to have a bearing on the operations/performance of the Company".

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange has sought clarification from Maruti Suzuki India Limited with respect to recent news item captioned "Maruti bags army order for 4,000 Gypsys, its largest yet". In this regard, Exchange have advised the Company to provide clarification/confirmation on the news item in detail including the following: a) Whether such event/negotiations/article stated in published news were taking place? If so, you are advised to provide the said information along with the sequence of events in chronological order and the material impact of this article on the Company. b) Whether company are aware of any information that has not been announced to the Exchanges under clause 36 of the Listing Agreement. The response from the Company is awaited.

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange had sought clarification from Maruti Suzuki India Limited with respect to a news item captioned "MFs dig in for fight on Maruti's Gujarat plant". The Company has clarified that "We have already informed the Stock Exchanges in March-14 that the Board has approved that a 100% Suzuki subsidiary should make the investment in establishing new manufacturing facilities in Gujarat. The details of the Company, and how the investment would be financed were also made public. The Suzuki subsidiary would enter into an exclusive contract for manufacturing cars for MSIL and that in accordance with Section 188 of the New Company s Act, we will be putting up this proposal for shareholder voting. In pursuance of this voting, on June 06, 2014, we put up a presentation, meant for investors, highlighting the salient features of the proposed contract manufacturing arrangement in the public domain through the stock exchanges and the Company s Website. The benefits of the arrangement to MSIL were highlighted in this presentation. Subsequent to this, we met our institutional shareholders and proxy advisory firms and explained the merits of the proposed arrangement for Gujarat and answered their questions, and gave clarifications. No further information was shared and there has been no event / negotiation as referred in your email / the Business Standard article. It is also pertinent to clarify that the article in Business Standard mentions some points which are factually incorrect. For instance, the article states The Company has, however, maintained the move will only result in reducing the cost of manufacturing its cars . The fact is the Company has never stated this at all. What the Company has stated is that this arrangement will result in our making the same profit as we would have made if we had invested our money, with an additional treasury income arising from our not having to invest our money. This would mean higher returns on investment as compared to the option of the Company investing its own funds in Gujarat capacity. There is also a mention in the Business Standard article of the company "...get (ting) into distribution instead of the complete value chain . A Car company to be successful has to carry out several functions like R&D, product development, sourcing, manufacturing, sales, service and supply of after-market parts. Manufacturing alone cannot ensure the success of a car company in the market as can be seen from the market shares in India of some car manufacturing giants of the world. For most of these companies, a limited sales and service network has been the most decisive factor for their market position. Also, there is no car company in the world to our knowledge that does the complete value chain itself. On the contrary most car companies in the world and India have a high level of outsourcing of manufacturing; generally three-fourths of the car by value is outsourced".

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange has sought clarification from Maruti Suzuki India Limited with respect to recent news item captioned "MFs dig in for fight on Maruti's Gujarat plant". In this regard, Exchange have advised the Company to provide clarification/confirmation on the news item in detail including the following:   a) Whether such event/negotiations/article stated in published news were taking place? If so, you are advised to provide the said information along with the sequence of events in chronological order and the material impact of this article on the Company. b) Whether company are aware of any information that has not been announced to the Exchanges under clause 36 of the Listing Agreement.  The response from the Company is awaited.

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange sought clarification from Maruti Suzuki India Limited with respect to news item captioned "Competition panel slaps Rs. 2,545 cr fine on carmakers". The Companny has clarified that "The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has come out with its final order late last evening with respect to the investigation against 17 car manufacturers in India. As per the order, the car manufactures are found indulging in anti competitive conduct and abuse of dominant position, which is in violation of Section 3 and 4 of the Competition Act 2002. However, at the outset the final order of CCI would not impact Maruti Suzuki India Limited at this juncture as the Delhi High Court vide its order dated 29.04.2013 and 13.08.2014 that the final order of the CCI shall not be given effect to till after expiry of 10 days from either the vacation of stay Order dated 06.02.2013 of the Madras High Court or issuance of a final order in the Writ Petition before the Madras High Court. Meanwhile after examining the final order of CCI, we shall be taking necessary legal steps as advised by our advocates.  As per the final order of CCI, it has directed Maruti Suzuki India Limited to do certain compliances in order to stop the anti-competitive activities allegedly carried out by Maruti Suzuki India Limited and has further imposed a fine of INR 471.14 Crores.  Maruti Suzuki will explore all legal options in the light of the CCI Order.   It is pertinent to note that as per the order of Delhi High Court dated 29-04-2013, the final order of CCI would apply to Maruti Suzuki after the expiry of a period of 10 days from the final order in the Writ Petition before the Madras High Court, which is still pending".

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The media had reports that Maruti Suzuki India Limited  is in pact to buy on lease right of Navi Mumbai land from RPG Life Sciences Limited . The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the company. Maruti Suzuki India Limited has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "That Maruti Suzuki India Limited(MSIL) had entered into a Memorandum of Understanding(MOU) with RPG Life Sciences Ltd. in August 2012 for acquiring leasehold rights through Deed of Assignment in respect of land measuring 14148.90 sq.mtr. out of total land admeasuring 48632 sq.mtr. falling under Plot No. 25&25A situated at Trans-Thane Creek Industrial Area (T.T.C. Industrial Area) within the village limit of Pawne and within the limits of Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation, Taluka & Registration Sub District- Thane and Registration District- Thane Maharashtra together with any structure viz. Process Development Lab Standing thereon.This MOU is subject to conclusion on fulfillment of terms and conditions mentioned therein. That as part of legal due diligence, MSIL has, through its advocate Mr. D.C. Daga, released a Public Notice today in certain newspapers seeking comments and objections from any person to the proposed transaction. That MSIL is seeking to acquire this land for setting up 'Regional Office' facilities in the Mumbai Region in due course. That setting up 'Regional Office' facilities in various regions of the country is in the ordinary course of business of MSIL and in no way affects materially its operations."

SUBJECT: Reconstitution of the Board of Directors
DETAILS: Maruti Suzuki India Limited has informed the Exchange that: "That the Board of Directors of the Company, in its meeting held on 29th October 2007, has decided to re-constitute the Board as per following details:(1) Mr. Jagdish Khattar, the present Managing Director will retire 18th December 2007 on attaining the age of 65, in accordance with company rules. (2) Mr. Shinzo Nakanishi who is currently Non-executive Chairman of Maruti Suzuki India Limited and Senior Managing Executive officer in Suzuki Motor Corporation (SMC), will succeed Mr. Khattar as Managing Director with effect from l9th December 2007. (3) Mr. R.C.Bhargava, who is currently Non-executive Director will assume charge as Non-executive Chairman with effect from 19th December 2007. (4) Mr. Tsuneo Kobayashi, present Sr. Joint Managing Director shall return to Japan and Mr. Tsuneo Ohashi shall succeed Mr. Kobayashi with effect from lst January 2008 as Director in charge of Production. (5) Mr. M.Osada present Director (R&D) shall return to Japan and Mr. T. Hasuike, currently Managing Executive Officer in SMC, shall succeed Mr. Osada with effect from lst January 2008 as Director in charge of Product Planning & Technical Divisions."

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The media had reports on August 22, 2006 that Maruti Udyog Limited is likely to issue bonus shares. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. Maruti Udyog Limited has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "We clarify that there is no such proposal for issuance of bonus shares under consideration and we have not released any information in this regard to anybody."

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The media had reports that Maruti Udyog Limited is likely to issue bonus shares. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. Reply is awaited from Maruti Udyog Limited.

SUBJECT: Reg 7 of SEBI (Susbs Acq of shares & Takeovers)
DETAILS: Maruti Udyog Limited has informed the Exchange that Life Insurance Corporation of India has acquired 16800000 shares aggregating to 5.81% of the total paid up capital of Maruti Udyog Limited on January 16, 2006. The mode of acquisition is off Market deal and the shareholding of Life Insurance Corporation of India after the said acquisition is 28821526 shares aggregating to 9.97% of the total paid up capital of Maruti Udyog Limited.

SUBJECT: Reg.13-SEBI(Prohibition of Insider Trading Regulations)1992
DETAILS: Maruti Udyog Limited has informed the Exchange that The President of India acting through the Joint Secretary Department of Heavy Industry has sold 2,31,12,804 shares aggregating to 8% of the total share capital of Maruti Udyog Limited. The mode of sale is through off market transactions and the shareholding of The President of India acting through the Joint Secretary Department of Heavy Industry after the said sale is 2,97,11,216 shares aggregating to 10.28% of the total share capital of Maruti Udyog Limited.

SUBJECT: Reg.13-SEBI(Prohibition of Insider Trading Regulations)1992
DETAILS: Government of India, Ministry of Finance has informed the Exchange that The President of India acting through the Joint Secretary Department of Heavy Industry has sold 2,31,12,804 shares aggregating to 8% of the total paid up capital of Maruti Udyog Limited. The mode of sale is through off market transactions and the shareholding of The President of India acting through the Joint Secretary Department of Heavy Industry after the said sale is 2,97,11,216 shares aggregating to 10.28% of the total paid up capital of Maruti Udyog Limited.

SUBJECT: Purchase of shares
DETAILS: Life Insurance Corporation of India has informed the Exchange that they have acquired 1,68,00,000 equity shares of Maruti Udyog Limited @ Rs.682/- per share in the process of disinvestments of shares by the Department of Disinvestment, Ministry of Finance, Government of India. The Corporation has paid the full consideration of Rs.1145.76 crore on January 17, 2006 as per allotment letter from Govt. of India ref.F.No.7/4/2005-DOD dated January 12, 2006.

SUBJECT: Press Release

SUBJECT: Change in Board of Directors
DETAILS: Maruti Udyog Limited has informed the Exchange that Mr. Amal Ganguli, has submitted his resignation which was considered and accepted by the BODs in their meeting held on December 24, 2005. The Board has filled up the casual vacancy caused due to the resignation of Mr. Amal Ganguli by appointing Mr. Kalyan Bose in his place and stead, as a non executive independent director of the company w.e.f. December 24, 2005.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Maruti Udyog Limited has informed the Exchange that Government of India, who is holding 18.28% in the equity capital of the company, vide letter no. F.No.2(8)/89-PE-VI dated July 22, 2005 has nominated Dr. Surajit Mitra, Joint Secretary, Department of Heavy Industry as a Part -time Director on the Board of the Company in Place of Mr. S.V. Bhave subject to the approval of the shareholders in the General Meeting of the Company. Consequently, the Company in its Meeting of the BODs held on July 25, 2005 has accepeted the same and appointed Dr. Surajit Mitra as Part - time Director in place of Mr. S.V. Bhave.

SUBJECT: Re-appointment
DETAILS: Maruti Udyog Limited has informed the Exchange that though there has been no change in the company's directorate, however the following directors have been re-appointed in the Board Meeting held on May 06, 2005 as under: 1) Mr. Jagdish Khattar has been re-appointed as the Managing Director for a period of three years or till his attaining the age of 65 years whichever is earlier; and 2)Mr. Kinji Saito has been re-appointed as a whole-time director designated as Director (Marketing & Sales) for a period of two years. The company has further informed that both these re-appointments take effect from May 30, 2005 and/or subject to approval of the members of the company in the ensuing AGM.

SUBJECT: Clarification of News
DETAILS: Clarification of News : The press had reports on February 12, 2005 that Suzuki may make an open offer for Maruti Udyog Limited. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the press and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. Maruti Udyog Limited has in its letter inter-alia stated, "We have learnt from Suzuki Motor Corporation (SMC) that they have not taken any decision to make an open offer for shares of MUL. No communication in this regard was made by either SMC or by us with Press/Media. The rumour about an open offer by SMC for shares of MUL, as reported in the press is thus denied."

SUBJECT: Clarification of News
DETAILS: Clarification of News : The press had reports on February 12, 2005 that Suzuki may make an open offer for Maruti Udyog Limited. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the press and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. Reply is awaited from Maruti Udyog Limited.

SUBJECT: Change in company's directorate
DETAILS: Maruti Udyog Limited has informed the Exchange that Mr. Junzo Sugimori, Joint Managing Director tendered his resignation vide  a letter dated September 22, 2004 in the meeting of the BoD's of the company held on September 23, 2004 and the same is accepted by the Board. Further, Mr. Hirofumi Nagao, erstwhile Executive Director (Administration) was elevated and appointed as a whole time Director re-designated as Joint Managing Director in the casual vacancy caused by the resignation of Mr. J Sugimori subject to the approval of the shareholders in the General Meeting of the Company.

SUBJECT: Press Release
DETAILS: Maruti Udyog Limited has informed the Exchange that the BoD's of the company examined various options for expanding production capacity in view of the fact that the existing production facility in Gurgaon was operating at close to full capacity. The Board decided the best option would be to set up a new joint venture company with Suzuki Motor Corporation of Japan to manage and operate a new vehicle manufacturing plant. The Board further decided that Maruti Udyog Limited will control a 70 per cent stake in the new joint venture company and Suzuki Motor Corporation, Japan, will hold the remaining 30 per cent stake in the new company. The details of the press release issued by the Company regarding the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).
